guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"2o140","text":"Workflow was designed and optimised for sample preparation of 16S rRNA gene amplicons with the use of random hexamer-free Rolling Circle Amplification followed by MinION MK1b sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":186,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2g1jc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q50j","text":"However, this protocol can be customised for amplification of any prokaryotic and eukaryotic gene from ~200 to ~2000bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":119,"style":"align-justify"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"356qn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5t0a2","text":"Prepare 5-10ml of 70% ethanol depending on the number of samples, e.g. 3.5ml of 100% ethanol with 1.5ml of Molecular Grade Water and keep it on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":8,"length":22,"style":"bold"},{"offset":71,"length":21,"style":"bold"},{"offset":98,"length":31,"style":"bold"},{"offset":132,"length":1,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8gggh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9dr4q","text":"Combine replicates (3x20\u00b5l) into single 2ml tube, then add 30\u00b5l of magnetic beads (0.5x ratio) to the 60\u00b5l of PCR product and incubate for . The place tube in the magnetic rack, allow beads to set then discard the liquid. Subsequently, wash the pellet twice with 200\u00b5l of freshly prepared ice-cold 70% ethanol. Discard the ethanol and briefly centrifuge the tube at low speed, place the tube back on the magnetic rack, remove residuals of the ethanol and place the tube at the heat block for around  . Be careful not to overdry the beads. Use 20\u00b5l Molecular Grade Water kept at the heat block   to resuspend the beads, incubate the tube for  . Then place the tube back on the rack, allow beads to set and transfer the 20\u00b5l PCR product into a fresh 2ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":40,"length":8,"style":"bold"},{"offset":59,"length":22,"style":"bold"},{"offset":102,"length":19,"style":"bold"},{"offset":262,"length":47,"style":"bold"},{"offset":543,"length":26,"style":"bold"},{"offset":718,"length":16,"style":"bold"},{"offset":748,"length":8,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":138,"length":1,"key":0},{"offset":499,"length":1,"key":1},{"offset":593,"length":1,"key":2},{"offset":641,"length":1,"key":3}],"data":[]},{"key":"4au79","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3s2j0","text":" steps.section: Self-ligation for the formation of plasmid-like structure

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ta3","text":"Vortex HighPrep\u2122reagents and transfer 150\u00b5l of magnetic beads into a clean 2ml tube. Place the tube on a magnetic rack for  or until beads separate from the liquid. While the tube is on the magnetic rack, remove 90\u00b5l of clear buffer  without disturbing the beads and place it inside the lid of the 2ml tube. Then discard remaining 60\u00b5l of the buffer without disturbing the beads. Subsequently, transfer exactly 75\u00b5l of clear buffer (concentrate beads by 50%) from the lid into the tube and discard the remaining wastes from the tube's lid. Remove the tube from magnetic rack and gently vortex to resuspend the beads. Keep 50% concentrated beads at room temperature until needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":38,"length":24,"style":"bold"},{"offset":75,"length":8,"style":"bold"},{"offset":212,"length":20,"style":"bold"},{"offset":298,"length":8,"style":"bold"},{"offset":331,"length":4,"style":"bold"},{"offset":411,"length":20,"style":"bold"},{"offset":626,"length":18,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[{"offset":123,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"89le4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ehnku","text":"Add precisely 17.5\u00b5l concentrated beads (0.35x ratio) to 50\u00b5l of a self-ligation mix from Step 4. Gently mix the tube by pipetting up and down then, incubate the mixture for  . Place the tube on a magnetic rack and allow the beads to separate. The beads will bind to long linear amplicons (i.e., chimeric amplicons) while the liquid contains short linear amplicon and plasmid-like structures. steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"7g9gl","text":"The 57.5\u00b5l of concentrated beads from Step 5 is used for the cleanup of RCA fragmented products.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":4,"length":29,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ch0jt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a6vo2","text":"Gently vortex the concentrated beads (-50%) and add exactly 22.75\u00b5l of concentrated beads (0.35x ratio) to 65\u00b5l of RCA fragmented products (or recalculate the volume of concentrated beads if necessary). The beads contain long linear, concatemerized amplicons while the liquid contains short (<2000bp) fragments. Subsequently, wash the pellet twice with 200\u00b5l of freshly prepared ice-cold 70% ethanol. Discard the ethanol and briefly centrifuge the tube at low speed, place back the tube at the magnetic rack, remove residuals of the ethanol and place the tube at the heat block for around  . Remember to do not overdry the beads. Use 65\u00b5l of Molecular Grade Water kept at the heat block  to resuspend the beads, incubate the tube for  . Then place the tube back on the rack, allow beads to set and transfer the 63\u00b5l of RCA product into a fresh 2ml tube.
